sub_title: Crew member OPS @Moxy Hotels I Cross-cultural Communication Trainer I North Point Academy Certificate in Professional Coaching
summary:
What do you wanna be when you grow up? 

My mom often says that I used to go on and on about wanting to speak many foreign languages and travel all over the world to connect with a considerable amount of passionate, diverse and inspiring individuals. Today I am down to 3 languages (Italian-English-Mandarin Chinese; Spanish & Dutch on the way), 30 visited countries and I recently started calling myself a "multipotentialite", i.e. "an individual with many interests and creative pursuits" inspired by Emilie Wapnick's TED Talk.

I have grown up being fully involved and positively transformed by my family business that has been operating in the Food & Beverage Industry for more than 45 years, so much that today I happily welcome challenges and hard work, making sure to set the example by doing while emphasising collaboration and communication when managing myself and others. 

14+ years in living, studying and working abroad (EU, China, Singapore, U.A.E., Canada & The Netherlands), I quickly identify valuable and strategic solutions to most common and uncommon customer’s pain points, always driven by an entrepreneurial mind.

My specialties: 
- Management and enhancement of the guest's experience.
- AM/PM & Night Hotel shifts as HM, Ambassador & Night Ambassador. 
- Performance & customer satisfaction improvement.
- Capacity to train, coach, communicate & lead in Italian, English and Mandarin Chinese.
- Ability to exceptionally and positively influence my workmates and my work environment.
- Events feasibility, planning, build-up & implementation.
- Curiosity that leads me to endless questions followed by satisfying answers. 
- Liaison and sincerely connect with staff, partners & suppliers.
- Tour leader for medium size groups worldwide.

I am constantly looking for new projects and teams that allow me to continue to leave an impact and being impacted at the same time, while preferably operating in the Hospitality, PR, Training and Development Industries.  

Attracted to companies that leave space for trust, transparency and personal growth. 

Vegetarian and sugar- free recipes are one of my favorite pastimes and so is a long walk in a nearby park, which let my imagination run wild while helping me better reconnect with the surrounding world.
I motivate and network with fellow entrepreneurs, colleagues and friends to create eco-destinations and events, sustainable lifestyles and minds.

projects.title: Welcome China Global Webinar
projects.description:
• Consecutive broadcast from 13 different locations, one after another, worldwide
• Experts from the travel and tourism industries based across multiple time zones discussed about the Chinese Outbound Tourism.

Broadcasted on September 24th, 2014, and organized by COTRI China Outbound Tourism Research Institute, Dragon Trail Interactive and gbtimes. 12 hours long seminar that was possible also thank you to the COTRI Country Partners Cooperation: Rossetto Solutions at the time contributed as COTRI Country Partner (Italy).

profile_positions.title: Crew Member OPS I Front Desk Associate

profile_positions.description: I have been personally partnering with Smile To Move since 2015, that was when I started co-engaging into the creation and implementation of several trainings that focus on the capacity of effectively communicating inter-culturally to create space for multicultural teams to thrive beyond social-cultural and traditional beliefs (Main country focus: Europe & China).
profile_positions.title: International Trainer

profile_positions.description: I help Italian students and business people to communicate more effectively and comfortably in English. I help my students to put English into action with relevant vocabulary.
profile_positions.title: Conversational English Language Coach

profile_positions.description:
It's often about challenging our family to always try to find better ways to be a good example for ourselves and the world we live in, while creating more awareness around the many impacts we consciously and often subconsciously leave behind. 

• Being a mom makes me more accountable for what I believe in, and gives me that extra dose of eagerness to be consistent and do what I say or I might encourage some other people to do. 

• On a daily basis managing a family requires a lot of planning ahead but also a lot of creative thinking when unexpected events happen. An urge towards understanding how relationships really work and how "small and big brains" operate showed up immediately the day that my husband and I started this adventure together. 

• A true understanding of what it means to be empathetic, to offer unconditional love and care kicked in together with realising that the creation of a judgement-free environment requires a good dose of daily practice and the need of actively listening to people around us.
profile_positions.title: Domestic Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for all aspects of the hotel's operation; working collaboratively with the different departments in the support office, creating the optimal working environment to enable the whole hotel team to deliver the desired guest experience. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
• Seek ways to deliver a memorable guest experience at citizenM and empower and inspire the hotel team to do the same.
• Lead, train and coach the hotel team to improve service and to support the operational success of citizenM.
• Develop and nurture talent within the team and provide feedback via monthly and yearly evaluations
oversee hotel staffing to ensure efficient workforce management.
• Maintain the hotel environment and building to ensure a clean, safe and comfortable experience in accordance with citizenM brand promises.
• Demonstrate product knowledge of canteenM, societyM and CloudM and with that overseeing F&B revenue targets and purchasing of all food and beverage items and hotel operating equipment
• Manage stock in line with fluctuating levels of business, minimising waste, and delivering a monthly stock report - working closely with the Assistant Hotel Managers and the F&B Manager. 
• Regularly report to the support office on financial performance of the hotel, payroll, invoicing, and human resources.
• Co-work towards maximising revenue opportunities and control costs in line with budgets, while providing added value to hotel guests.
• Cash management.
• Represent citizenM within Rotterdam, promoting the company values to an external audience in support of growth together with the Support Office Commercial Team.
• Cover regular Day & Night shifts, working closely with the Team - to understand their wants and needs and to verify the guests experience first-hand.
profile_positions.title: Hotel Manager

profile_positions.description:
• I supported Cartus in the re-localization of an Italian couple relocated from Italy to Shanghai. I was invited to hold a cross-cultural training program to discuss day-to-day life in Shanghai. Topics included in the session were: medical care, housing, shopping, food and socialization. The session was held in Italian, May-June 2014.

• I supported Cartus in the re-localization of a Spanish/Argentinean citizen relocated from UK to Shanghai. Initiated extensive written and verbal communication to generate discussion and explored day-to-day life in Shanghai. Topics included in the session were: medical care, housing, shopping, food and socialization. The session was held in English, May-June 2014.

• I supported Cartus in the re-localization of an American citizen relocated from U.S.A. to Shanghai. Topics included: apps & maps, medical care, shopping, food, socialization and volunteering. The session was held in English, November 2016.
profile_positions.title: Presenter

company.name: Rossetto Solutions Co., Ltd. - 尚晖(上海)商务咨询有限公司

profile_positions.company: Rossetto Solutions Co., Ltd. - 尚晖(上海)商务咨询有限公司
profile_positions.description:
Rossetto Solutions Co., Ltd. - 尚晖(上海)商务咨询有限公司
Business & Travel Consultancy Services - Training & Development 

Rossetto Solutions Co., Ltd. was a team of mediators in China - every one of us with their own expertise and passions – partnering together with clients to better understand and connect with China and its people.

Key areas of business included:

• Planning and coordinating each company participation to several promotional events and exhibitions. 
• Translation & Interpretation services (Created and managed clients’ promotional materials: Led content and website development for companies seeking to generate Chinese customers. Carefully and successfully selected and hired: interpreters, translators and hostesses).
• Acquiring a large range of Chinese contacts who proved to be valuable assets for resolving business issues and/or voids.
• Tourist destination satisfaction and perception.
• Validating Chinese distributors/ manufacturers.
• Negotiating sales, checking for product quality and local competition while selecting and assessing sales channels for best distribution in the Chinese market.
• Co-arranging product shipments.
profile_positions.title: Founder & Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
As China Representative for L'Inglesina Baby S.p.A. I was in charge of actively contributing to the definition, implementation and management of the company's strategic plans while carefully acknowledging and dealing with the important cultural gaps and level of understanding of the same tasks among the Chinese collaborators. Some of my main responsibilities included:  

• Participation in exhibitions in Shanghai.  Setting-up and participation at the CBME Fair in Shanghai. Worked with venue owners, management, Chinese and Italian partners to plan the event details and specifics and make sure everything ran as desired. 
• Further efficient development of the brand Inglesina in China.
• Extension of the existing distribution network by acquisition of new prospective distribution partners. 
• Support of end customers in collaboration with the regional distributor. Researched customer's needs and feedbacks to meet consumer needs and maximize profit.
• Conducting market research on product iterations through qualitative studies and quantitative surveys.
• Reporting to Inglesina in Italy.
profile_positions.title: China Representative

profile_positions.description: As Editor for China I was looking for unusual stories that could allow the readers to experience China from the inside while gaining more of a local knowledge and prospective. STREAM's stories, articles, reportages and booklets wanted to engage intelligent and interested people in a new type of media conversation.
profile_positions.title: Editor - China

profile_positions.location: Urban Best Practices Area located on the Puxi side within the Expo Park
profile_positions.description:
• I acted as main point of contact in charge of budget planning, translation and interpretation services from Italian to Chinese/English and from Chinese/English to Italian, promotional materials and merchandise sold within the Venice Pavilion.  

• I supervised customs clearance formalities and arrangements for all exhibits sent back to Italy while showing Italian exhibits during the Shanghai World Exposition.

• Liaised between Italian and International Institutions in Shanghai. I was in charge of managing the Venice Pavilion: organized, trained, and managed 14 personnel from Italy and China. I was also coordinating daily logistic issues; VIP’s accreditation; and the arrangement of press conferences, forums, gala dinners, opening ceremonies and product launches.

• I attended and partook in the official “Participants Meetings for the World Exposition Shanghai China 2010” as Representative for the City of Venice (the event had more than 300 Representatives from 127 countries).
profile_positions.title: Venice Pavilion Director at the Shanghai World Expo 2010
